title: Crispy Skin Salmon & Greens
description: Pan-seared salmon with deeply crisped skin served atop a warm garlicky sauté of mixed greens and lemony vinaigrette. Bright, savory, and quick to make—texture from the salmon skin contrasts with tender greens and a hint of acidity.

ingredients.notes: 2 fillets about 6–8 oz each, skin scored lightly
for basting salmon and finishing greens

ingredients.display_name: mixed greens (baby spinach and baby kale), packed

steps.text: Remove salmon from refrigerator 10 minutes before cooking and pat skin and flesh dry with paper towels; score skin lightly if thick, then season both sides evenly with half the salt and half the pepper.

Heat a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat until hot; add 1 tablespoon olive oil and swirl to coat. When the oil shimmers, lay salmon skin-side down in skillet away from you, pressing gently with a spatula for 10–15 seconds to prevent curling.
Continue to cook without moving until skin is deeply golden and crisp and salmon is cooked about two-thirds of the way through (about 5–6 minutes depending on thickness).

Flip salmon carefully, add butter to the pan, and baste the tops with melted butter and pan juices for 1–2 minutes until salmon reaches desired doneness (medium = warm center). Remove salmon to a warm plate and tent with foil to rest.
Wipe pan lightly with a paper towel leaving fond; reduce heat to medium, add remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, then sauté shallot until soft and translucent, about 1–2 minutes.

Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes if using; cook stirring until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add mixed greens in batches, tossing to wilt each batch and coating with oil and shallot—about 2–3 minutes total until just tender.
Stir in lemon juice, capers if using, remaining salt and pepper to taste, and a small knob of butter to finish the greens for sheen and flavor. Toss to combine and heat through for 30–60 seconds.
Divide greens between plates and top each with a salmon fillet skin-side up; garnish with chopped parsley and an extra squeeze of lemon if desired. Serve immediately.
